abstract: John A. Thain, who received $15 million when he became chief executive of Merrill Lynch last December, may get as much as $5.22 million more if the firm’s takeover by Bank of America is completed by Dec. 31, Bloomberg News reports.
lead_paragraph: John A. Thain, who received $15 million when he became chief executive of Merrill Lynch last December, may get as much as $5.22 million more if the firm’s takeover by Bank of America is completed by Dec. 31, Bloomberg News reports.

headline.main: Merrill Chief May Get $5.2 Million in Firm’s Takeover
